sen.j: 三宅八幡駅（みやけはちまんえき）は、京都府京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄叡山本線にある鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, the Miyakehachiman Station is a stop on the Eizan Main Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, the Miyakehachiman Station is a stop on the Eizan Main Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Miyakehachiman Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Eizan Main Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two separate platforms serving two tracks.
It's an unmanned station with two separate platforms serving two tracks.
It's an unmanned station with two separate platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: 出町柳駅行きホームには1両分程の長さの上屋があり、八瀬比叡山口駅行きホームの中ほどには小さな上屋を備えたベンチがある。
sen.e: The Demachiyanagi Station-bound platform has a roof having a length of a vehicle, whereas the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station-bound platform has a smaller roof in the middle with a bench.
The Demachiyanagi Station-bound platform has a roof the length of a vehicle, whereas the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station-bound platform has a smaller roof in the middle with a bench.
The Demachiyanagi Station-bound Platform has a roof the length of a vehicle, whereas the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station-bound Platform has a smaller roof in the middle with a bench.

sen.j: 柵や上屋の柱などは三宅八幡宮に因んで朱色に塗られている。
sen.e: The fence and columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors which have to do with the Miyake Hachimangu Shrine.
The fence and columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors, as associated with Miyake Hachimangu Shrine.
The fence and columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors, as associated with Miyake Hachimangu Shrine.

sen.j: 主要な出入り口はホームの八瀬比叡山口駅側にあり、駅構内踏切（第1種甲）もこちら側にあるが、出町柳駅行きホームの出町柳側にも小さな出入り口がある。
sen.e: The main entrance is on the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station side of the platforms as well as a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), and another small entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the Demachiyanagi-bound platform.

The main entrance is on the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station side of the platforms along with a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), and another small entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi side of ｔhe Demachiyanagi-bound platform.

The main entrance is on the Yase-Hieizanguchi Station side of the platforms along with a level crossing in the station (Class 1 Ko), and another small entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi side of ｔhe Demachiyanagi-bound Platform.
sen.cmt: the Demachiyanagi-bound platform → the Demachiyanagi-bound Platform

sen.j: 上下共にバリアフリーには対応していない。
sen.e: None of the inbound and outbound platforms is barrier-free.
None of the inbound and outbound platforms is barrier-free.
None of the inbound and outbound platforms is barrier-free.

sen.j: レール面からホーム面までの階段のみであるが、車椅子等での利用には介護者が必要。
sen.e: From the track level to the platform level can be accessed only by stairs, and thus caretakers are needed for a person in wheelchairs.
The route from the track level to the platform level can be accessed only by stairs, and consequently caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.
The route from the track level to the platform level can be accessed only by stairs, and consequently caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.

sen.j: 大原街道（国道367号）が 高野川 (京都市)を渡る 三宅橋から100mほど南に入った所にある。
sen.e: Ohara-kaido (National Route 367) is about 100 meters to the south of the Miyake-bashi Bridge over Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City).
Ohara-kaido (National Route 367) is about 100 meters to the south of Miyake-bashi Bridge over the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City).
Ohara-kaido (National Route 367) is about 100 meters to the south of Miyake-bashi Bridge over the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City).

sen.j: 回りは古くからの農家の面影を残す住居の混じる住宅地である。
sen.e: The area around the station is a residential area including some old farmer's houses.
The area around the station is a residential area that contains some old farmhouses.
The area around the station is a residential area that contains some old farmhouses.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）9月27日 京都電燈の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on September 27, 1925 as a station owned by Kyoto Dento.
The station opened on September 27, 1925 as a station owned by Kyoto Dento.
September 27, 1925: The station opened as a station owned by Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 会社譲渡により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On March 2, 1942, the station came to be owned by Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of transfer of the company.
On March 2, 1942, the station came to be owned by Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of the transfer of the company.
March 2, 1942: The station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the transfer of the company.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社譲渡により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of transfer of the company.
On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of the transfer of the company.
April 1, 1986: The station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of the transfer of the company.

sen.j: 駅名の由来となった三宅八幡宮へは、叡山電鉄鞍馬線の八幡前駅 (京都府)の方が近いが、三宅八幡宮への正式な参道（表参道）はこちら側からであり、駅前から北側に三宅八幡宮の朱塗りの大鳥居が見える。
sen.e: The Hachimanmae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kurama-Sen (Kurama Line), the Eizan Electric Railway is closer to the Miyake Hachimangu Shrine, from which the station name was originated, but the Miyakehachiman Station leads to an official approach (Omotesando) to the shrine, and a vermillion O-torii (gateway) of the shrine can be seen from the station in the north direction.

Hachimanmae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kurama-Sen (Kurama Line), the Eizan Electric Railway is closer to Miyake Hachimangu Shrine, from which the station name was originated, but Miyakehachiman Station leads to an official approach (Omotesando) to the shrine, and a vermillion O-torii (gateway) of the shrine can be seen from the station in the northerly direction.

Hachimanmae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kurama Line of the Eizan Electric Railway is closer to Miyake Hachimangu Shrine, from which the station name was originated, but Miyakehachiman Station leads to an official approach (Omotesando) to the shrine, and a vermillion O-torii (gateway) of the shrine can be seen from the station in the northerly direction.
